TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AuthenticationTypes extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: The enumeration specifies the types of authentication used in . This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 보안 플래그 ReadonlyServer, FastBind 등 다른 플래그와 함께에서 사용할 수 있습니다.The Secure flag can be used in combination with other flags such as ReadonlyServer, FastBind. 하지 않는 바인딩을 참조 하는 클라이언트가 Active Directory 도메인 서비스 개체를 명시적으로 Active Directory 도메인 서비스 서버 바인딩 문자열의 예를 들어 지정 하지 않고 바인딩할 하려고 하는 프로세스입니다.Serverless binding refers to a process in which a client attempts to bind to an Active Directory Domain Services object without explicitly specifying an Active Directory Domain Services server in the binding string, for example: ``` LDAP://CN=jsmith,DC=fabrikam,DC=Com ``` LDAP Lightweight Directory Access Protocol () 공급자는 Windows 2000 클라이언트에 대 한 최상의 도메인 컨트롤러 (DC)을 찾으려고 로케이터 서비스를 사용 하기 때문에 이것이 가능 합니다.This is possible because the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) provider relies on the locator services of Windows 2000 to find the best domain controller (DC) for the client. 그러나 클라이언트는 서버가 없는 바인딩 기능을 활용 하기 위해 Active Directory 도메인 서비스 도메인 컨트롤러에서 계정이 있어야 하 고 바인딩에 사용 되는 도메인 컨트롤러는 항상 기본 도메인 (도메인에 있어야 연결 된 바인딩을 수행 중인 스레드의 현재 보안 컨텍스트)입니다.However, the client must have an account on the Active Directory Domain Services domain controller to take advantage of the serverless binding feature, and the domain controller that is used by a serverless bind will always be located in the default domain (the domain associated with the current security context of the thread that's doing the binding). > [!NOTE] > 이러한 옵션을 모두 Novell Netware 디렉터리 서비스 (NDS) 시스템 공급자에서 사용할 수 있습니다.None of these options are supported by the Novell Netware Directory Service (NDS) system provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes Anonymous = int32(16)
Anonymous = 16

summary.span: No authentication is performed.

span.span: No authentication is performed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes Delegation = int32(256)
Delegation = 256

summary.span: Enables Active Directory Services Interface (ADSI) to delegate the user's security context, which is necessary for moving objects across domains.

span.span: Enables Active Directory Services Interface (ADSI) to delegate the user's security context, which is necessary for moving objects across domains.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes Encryption = int32(2)
Encryption = 2

summary.span: Attaches a cryptographic signature to the message that both identifies the sender and ensures that the message has not been modified in transit.

span.span: Attaches a cryptographic signature to the message that both identifies the sender and ensures that the message has not been modified in transit.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes FastBind = int32(32)
FastBind = 32

summary.span: Specifies that ADSI will not attempt to query the Active Directory Domain Services objectClass property.

span.span: Specifies that ADSI will not attempt to query the Active Directory Domain Services objectClass property.

summary.span: Therefore, only the base interfaces that are supported by all ADSI objects will be exposed.

span.span: Therefore, only the base interfaces that are supported by all ADSI objects will be exposed.

summary.span: Other interfaces that the object supports will not be available.

span.span: Other interfaces that the object supports will not be available.

summary.span: A user can use this option to boost the performance in a series of object manipulations that involve only methods of the base interfaces.

span.span: A user can use this option to boost the performance in a series of object manipulations that involve only methods of the base interfaces.

summary.span: However, ADSI does not verify if any of the request objects actually exist on the server.

span.span: However, ADSI does not verify if any of the request objects actually exist on the server.

summary.span: For more information, see the topic "Fast Binding Option for Batch Write/Modify Operations" in the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).

span.span: For more information, see the topic "Fast Binding Option for Batch Write/Modify Operations" in the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).

summary.span: For more information about the objectClass property, see the "Object-Class" topic in the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).

span.span: For more information about the objectClass property, see the "Object-Class" topic in the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes None = int32(0)
None = 0

summary.span: Equates to zero, which means to use basic authentication (simple bind) in the LDAP provider.

span.span: Equates to zero, which means to use basic authentication (simple bind) in the LDAP provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes ReadonlyServer = int32(4)
ReadonlyServer = 4

summary.span: For a WinNT provider, ADSI tries to connect to a domain controller.

span.span: For a WinNT provider, ADSI tries to connect to a domain controller.

summary.span: For Active Directory Domain Services, this flag indicates that a writable server is not required for a serverless binding.

span.span: For Active Directory Domain Services, this flag indicates that a writable server is not required for a serverless binding.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes Sealing = int32(128)
Sealing = 128

summary.span: Encrypts data using Kerberos.

span.span: Encrypts data using Kerberos.

summary.span: The flag must also be set to use sealing.

span.span: The flag must also be set to use sealing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes Secure = int32(1)
Secure = 1

summary.span: Requests secure authentication.

span.span: Requests secure authentication.

summary.span: When this flag is set, the WinNT provider uses NTLM to authenticate the client.

span.span: When this flag is set, the WinNT provider uses NTLM to authenticate the client.

summary.span: Active Directory Domain Services uses Kerberos, and possibly NTLM, to authenticate the client.

span.span: Active Directory Domain Services uses Kerberos, and possibly NTLM, to authenticate the client.

summary.span: When the user name and password are a null reference ( in Visual Basic), ADSI binds to the object using the security context of the calling thread, which is either the security context of the user account under which the application is running or of the client user account that the calling thread is impersonating.

span.span: When the user name and password are a null reference ( in Visual Basic), ADSI binds to the object using the security context of the calling thread, which is either the security context of the user account under which the application is running or of the client user account that the calling thread is impersonating.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes SecureSocketsLayer = int32(2)
SecureSocketsLayer = 2

summary.span: Attaches a cryptographic signature to the message that both identifies the sender and ensures that the message has not been modified in transit.

span.span: Attaches a cryptographic signature to the message that both identifies the sender and ensures that the message has not been modified in transit.

summary.span: Active Directory Domain Services requires the Certificate Server be installed to support Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption.

span.span: Active Directory Domain Services requires the Certificate Server be installed to support Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) encryption.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes ServerBind = int32(512)
ServerBind = 512

summary.span: If your ADsPath includes a server name, specify this flag when using the LDAP provider.

span.span: If your ADsPath includes a server name, specify this flag when using the LDAP provider.

summary.span: Do not use this flag for paths that include a domain name or for serverless paths.

span.span: Do not use this flag for paths that include a domain name or for serverless paths.

summary.span: Specifying a server name without also specifying this flag results in unnecessary network traffic.

span.span: Specifying a server name without also specifying this flag results in unnecessary network traffic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes Signing = int32(64)
Signing = 64

summary.span: Verifies data integrity to ensure that the data received is the same as the data sent.

span.span: Verifies data integrity to ensure that the data received is the same as the data sent.

summary.span: The flag must also be set to use signing.

span.span: The flag must also be set to use signing.
